mod-links:
**McHorse's mods**
> Download either latest versions, or refer to this compatibility table: https://github.com/mchorse/mclib/wiki/Compatibility-table-of-McHorse's-mods

‚Äî Aperture (requires **McLib**, optional integration with **Minema**): https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/aperture/
‚Äî Blockbuster (requires **McLib **and **Metamorph**, optional integration with **Aperture**): https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/blockbuster/
‚Äî Chameleon (requires **McLib **and **Metamorph**): https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/chameleon-morph/
‚Äî Emoticons (requires **McLib**, optional integration with **Blockbuster**): https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/emoticons/
‚Äî Mappet (requires **McLib **and **Metamorph**): https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/mappet/
‚Äî McLib: https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/mchorses-mclib/
‚Äî Metamorph (requires **McLib**): https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/metamorph/
‚Äî Minema: https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/minema/
‚Äî S&B (requires **McLib **and **Metamorph**): https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/snb/

minema-report:
In order for me to **efficiently** help you **to fix an issue** with **Minema** mod, please provide following:
1. Screenshot of where you installed `ffmpeg`, **entire window** please
2. File `config/minema.cfg` (drag and drop the file into the Discord window, **don't screenshot it**!)

If you haven't installed `ffmpeg` yet, you can download it:
‚Äî Windows: https://www.gyan.dev/ffmpeg/builds/ffmpeg-release-full.7z
‚Äî Everything else: https://ffmpeg.org/download.html

logs:
To identify and help you with an issue, let it be a bug or a crash, the mod developer, McHorse, needs **log files** (`.log` files). 

‚Äî **Crash log** files can be found in Minecraft's `crash-reports` folder, which is usually located in `%AppData%\.minecraft\crash-reports\` (on Windows). Look for the most recent file by creation date, and drag and drop file right here. 
‚Äî **Game log files** can be found in Minecraft's `logs` folder, which is usually located in `%AppData%\.minecraft\logs\`. If the bug happened in current game session, or in previous game session but you haven't launched Minecraft since then, then you can safely send here `latest.log` file within `logs` folder. Otherwise, you would need to find the correct file from the session in one of the dated files. That can be hard to do, so in case the error is reproducible, then just launch Minecraft again, reproduce it, and send the log file.

**Don't send screenshot(s)** of launcher's error popup, launcher's log window or opened log file in `Notepad.exe`, **it won't help** and will waste everyone's time!

cached-structure: It‚Äôs a common bug thanks to rewrite of structure morphs rendering that structure morphs **disappear in Blockbuster 2.2+**. To fix this, go to Ctrl + 0, Blockbuster, General and disable Cached structure rendering.

my-particles-not-work:
This is the **most popular FAQ so far**, so if your particles (be it Snowstorm or `particle` morph) **not work on body parts**, try following:
1. Enable `Use Target` toggle like shown here: https://youtu.be/bzhWB4U-nec?t=116
2. If 1. didn't work, drag the body part to the top of the body part list

get-mappet: Go to <#706084546646638632> channel (click on the blue thingy), click on ‚öíÔ∏è emoji, and then it will give you a role. Go to <#548439751682687016> and download latest `.zip` file, there will be Mappet. Make sure to install McLib, Metamorph and Blockbuster from the same zip file.
fix-structures: Somehow structure morph was broken in 2.2 update while trying to fix another bug. **To fix it**, go to Ctrl + 0, Blockbuster, **and disable** ‚ÄúCached structure rendering.‚Äù That should fix it.

bb-op-fix: In Blockbuster `2.3`+, OP support was added, so that random users **won't mess up the data on the server** (without being an OP user). This also causes the panels to be **disabled** (grayed out) when a singleplayer world **doesn't have commands enabled**. To fix this, either **open the world with commands to LAN**, or **watch this**: https://youtu.be/AeMlAzQIajE

model-textures:
After loading your model into Blockbuster, if you have a problem with textures not correctly showing up (i.e. random texture will popup or black and purple checkered), then do **one of the following**: 
1. If you have only **one texture**, remove the mtl file that was exported with OBJ model.
2. If you have **two or more** textures, you need to setup materials using this excerpt: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QdN4C3XFRDI?t=125

If you‚Äôll **still experience the problem**, screenshot your model‚Äôs folder and also the model‚Äôs `skins` folder.

orbit-modifier:
This excerpt shows how to **setup an orbit modifier** (follow and look modifiers are configured in a similar way):
https://youtu.be/aRNudxc2etE?t=66
bb-wav: Blockbuster's in-game audio sync works **only** with `.wav` (Wave) files. Renaming the audio file from `.mp3` or `.aiff` to `.wav` **won't do it**! You need to actually open the audio file in Audacity, and save it as a `.wav` file in order for it **to be converted properly**. You can download Audacity here: https://www.audacityteam.org/download/
wav: When adding an audio track to Blockbuster, it has to be PCM (uncompressed) `.wav`! You can‚Äôt just take any audio file, and rename the extension from `.mp3` to `.wav`! You have to open your audio file in Audacity (https://www.audacityteam.org), for example, and export it properly as PCM wav.

vague:
If you see this message, then unfortunately your description of the issue or the crash appears to be **vague** (as in it's unclear, doesn't have enough information to help you)! **Elaborate**, i.e. describe more precisely what happened and under what circumstances it happened. Screenshot(s) and logs may be needed.

**ProTips‚Ñ¢Ô∏è**: 

1. Avoid using words `it`, `this`, `that`, and others that don't provide concrete details of your issue/crash. 
**Bad** examples: `it doesn't work!`, `how do I fix this?` 
**Good** examples: `when I enable always render name tags, name tags don't appear!`, `How do I fix a hole in my model?`

2. **Be patient!** No one is online all the time. Cross-posting (posting same message across multiple text channels), pinging people, and repeatedly posting for updates in a short time span is frowned upon|| in this community||, which can result in ignore or even kick/ban. 

3. Don't assume that people know what are you talking about! This is not an ESP (extrasensory perception) community, and thus we don't posses telepathic abilities, i.e. **we can't read your mind**. Read carefully information you presented, and if you think that your description and screenshot don't make sense, try documenting your issue/crash again.
chameleon: Chameleon is a Minecraft mod to import **Bedrock/GeckoLib** animated models from **Blockbench** to be used with my other mods. If you **don't have** Chameleon settings or Chameleon model section, then **you downloaded wrong mod**! My Chameleon mod's version isn't `4.1.3`. You can download McHorse's Chameleon mod here: https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/chameleon-morph

Some people in the past haven't been able to set it up, and the way this feature was implemented doesn't guarantee other mods to work due to complexity of Minecraft mods and its hacky nature!

dev-builds:
Dev builds are mod versions that contain new features, crash and bug fixes, which wasn‚Äôt released yet and may require some testing. If you‚Äôd like to try them out, go to <#706084546646638632> channel, react ‚öíÔ∏è, go to <#548439751682687016>, and download the latest zip file provided in the last message, and install them into `.minecraft/mods/` like any other mod. 
**IMPORTANT**: dev builds are most likely not going to work with latest versions of the mods, so you need to **update ALL of the mods** provided in the zip, **NOT ONLY the one** you want to test out features for!
about-mchorse:
> **Q: What is McHorse's nationality?**
A: This information is publicly unknown, McHorse doesn't reveal his origin.

> **Q: Where does McHorse live, and how is he?**
A: McHorse doesn't reveal this information, so practically no one knows about it. 

> **Q: Would there be an updated Blockbuster version for newer Minecraft versions?**
A: It's been a long while since McHorse doesn't develop his mods anymore. Last updates (starting with Blockbuster 2.4) were brought by other mod developers. Chryfi has a plan to update Blockbuster (and its core dependencies: Metamorph and McLib) to 1.19+, but it's not going to happen any time soon.

> **Q: How can I thank McHorse for his work?**
A: You can subscribe to McHorse's Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/McHorse.  You may as well follow server's rules, respect each other, and thoroughly construct your question, so it was much easier to help with your problems.

This FAQ was brought to you by Kirkus.
